Article.ArticleTitle: Available data do not suggest Rickettsia rickettsii has been found in Indonesia.

AffiliationInfo.Affiliation: Uniformed Services University of the Health Sciences, 4301 Jones Bridge Road, Bethesda, MD, 20814, USA. Allen.Richards@comcast.net.

Reference.Citation: Abdad MY, Abdallah RA, Fournier PE, Stenos J, Vasoo S (2018) A concise review of the epidemiology and diagnostics of rickettsioses: Rickettsia and Orientia spp. Journal of Clinical Microbiology 56:1-10

Biggs HM, Behravesh CB, Bradley KK, Dahlgren FS, Drexler NA, Dumler JS, Folk SM, Kato CY, Lash RR, Levin ML, Massung RF, Nadelman RB, Nicholson WL, Paddock CD, Pritt BS, Traeger MS (2016) Diagnosis and management of tickborne rickettsial diseases: Rocky Mountain spotted fever and other spotted fever group rickettsioses, ehrlichioses, and anaplasmosis — United States. A practical guide for health care and public health professionals. MMWR Recommendations and Reports 65:1-45
Hechemy KE, Raoult D, Fox J, Han Y, Elliott LB, Rawlings J (1989) Cross-reaction of immune sera from patients with rickettsial diseases. Journal of Medical Microbiology 29:199–202
Kuo CC, Shu PY, Mu JJ, Wang HC (2015) High prevalence of Rickettsia spp. infections in small mammals in Taiwan. Vector Borne and Zoonotic Diseases 15(1):13–20. https://doi.org/10.1089/vbz.2014.1584

Lee JH, Park HS, Jung KD, Jang WJ, Koh SE, Kang SS, Lee IY, Lee WJ, Kim BJ, Kook YH, Park KH, Lee SH (2003) Identification of the spotted fever group rickettsiae detected from Haemaphysalis longicornis in Korea. Microbiology and Immunology 47:301–304. https://doi.org/10.1111/j.1348-0421.2003.tb03399.x
Luce-Fedrow A, Mullins K, Jiang J, Richards AL (2015) Strategies for detecting rickettsiae and diagnosing rickettsial diseases. Future Microbiology 10:537-564

Parola P, Paddock CD, Socolovschi C, Labruna MB, Mediannikov O, Kernif T, Abdad MY, Stenos J, Bitam I, Fournier PE, Raoult D (2013) Update on tick-borne rickettsioses around the world: a geographic approach. Clinical Microbiology Review 2:657-702

Richards AL, Ratiwayanto S, Rahardjo E, Kelly DJ, Dasch GA, Fryauff DJ, Bangs MJ. (2003) Evidence of infection with ehrlichiae and spotted fever group rickettsiae among residents of Gag Island, Indonesia. American Journal of Tropical Medicine and Hygiene 68:480-484
Satjanadumrong J, Robinson MT, Hughes T, Blacksell SD (2019) Distribution and ecological drivers of spotted fever group rickettsia in Asia. EcoHealth 16:611-626

Zhao S, Yang M, Liu G, Hornok S, Zhao S, Sang C, Tan W, Wang Y (2020) Rickettsiae in the common pipistrelle Pipistrellus pipistrellus (Chiroptera: Vespertilionidae) and the bat soft tick Argas vespertilionis) (Ixodida: Argasidae). Parasites Vectors 13:10
